Developing Random Math Art

August 21, 2014

You may have noticed the graph on the side. This is created dynamically by Javascript using random numbers and basic trig alterations of sine graphs. After a lot of googling, I was finally able to find a method. You first need to create a canvas object in your html

1 <canvas class = "sine" id="canvas" width=160 height=635></canvas>

Then create a canvas object in javascript pointing to that canvas.

1 var canvas=document.getElementById("canvas");
2 var ctx=canvas.getContext("2d");

Then you have to clear the canvas for any previous lines:

1 ctx.save();
2 
3 ctx.setTransform(1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0);
4 ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
5 
6 ctx.restore();

Now, draw the sine curve. There are many option you have here. I have a randomized amplitude and frequency for every 12th number with a max amplitude of 75 and a max frequency of 1.5.

 1 while( x<400)
 2 {   if(Math.floor(x)%12 ==0)
 3     {
 4           amp =  Math.floor(Math.random() * 75)+.01;
 5         width = Math.floor(Math.random() * 1.5)+.01;
 6     }    
 7         
 8     
 9     var y=amp*Math.sin(width*x)+ 80;
10     ctx.lineTo(y,x);
11      x=x+.05;
12 }

After that, you need to generate a randomized color gradient for the graph. To do so I used createLinearGradient.

 1 var gradient=ctx.createLinearGradient(0,0,0,300);
 2 var color1 = '#'+(0x1000000+(Math.random())*0xffffff).toString(16).substr(1,6)
 3 gradient.addColorStop("0",color1);
 4 var color2 = '#'+(0x1000000+(Math.random())*0xffffff).toString(16).substr(1,6)
 5 gradient.addColorStop(".25",color2);
 6 var color3 = '#'+(0x1000000+(Math.random())*0xffffff).toString(16).substr(1,6)
 7 var color4 = '#'+(0x1000000+(Math.random())*0xffffff).toString(16).substr(1,6)
 8 gradient.addColorStop(".5",color3);
 9 gradient.addColorStop("1.0",color4);
10 
11 // Fill with gradient
12 ctx.strokeStyle=gradient;
13 ctx.lineWidth=2.4;
14 
15 ctx.stroke();

Finally, a button to regenerate the sine.

1 <button onclick ="getSine()" class = "btn" id = "sinbtn"> Regenerate Sine </button>
